p: Evening primrose oil is very high in linoleic (70–74%) and γ-linolenic (8–10%) acids, and also contains other fatty acids: palmitic acid, oleic acid, stearic acid, and (in smaller amounts) myristic acid, oleopalmitic acid, vaccenic acid, eicosanoic acid, and eicosenoic acid (see Table 1) [ 8]. The phospholipid fraction comprises only 0.05% of the oil, and the following phospholipids have been identified in it: phosphatidylcholines (31.9%), phosphatidylinositols (27.1%), phosphatidylethanolamines (17.6%), phosphatidylglycerols (16.7%), and phosphatidic acids (6.7%) [ 6].
